isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - KENT-MOORE TACH-N-TIME DYNAMIC TIMING METER (ZTSE-4142) - TIMING LIGHT METHOD -- CRANKSHAFT MONITORING

step1.para: Clip an inductive pick-up from any standard gasoline engine type timing light around the metal loop on the TACH-N-TIMEt unit.
Set the switch to the "TIMING LIGHT" position. The display should read "0000---- 0.0."
Make sure all wires are clear of the fan, belts or other moving parts. Keep wires away from the exhaust manifold.
Start the engine. The injection sensor light on the unit should be blinking, indicating the proper function of connectors. Allow the engine to reach operating temperature.
Check initial dynamic timing and advance by adjusting the engine RPM as directed in Section 5.
Aim the timing light at the timing marks on the vibration damper. Push "INCREASE" or "DECREASE" switch until the timing mark lines up with the "TDC" indicator on the engine.

Engine RPM and the timing angle can be read directly from the ZTSE-4142 display Figure 4.10
.
Repaint the scraped fuel line when timing operation is complete to protect the line against corrosion.
